data.test_name: Electromagnetic Induction and Alternating Current Test - 2

1.q_string: A capacitor of capacitance \(2 \mu \mathrm{F}\) is charged to a potential difference of \(12 \mathrm{~V}\). It is then connected across an inductor of inductance \(0.6 \mathrm{mH}\). The current in the circuit when the potential difference across the capacitor is \(6 \mathrm{~V}\) is :

In the given branch \(\mathrm{AB}\) of a circuit a current \(\mathrm{I}=(10 \mathrm{t}+5) \mathrm{A}\) is flowing, where \(t\) is time in second. \(\mathrm{At} \mathrm{t}=0\), the potential difference between points \(\mathrm{A}\) and \(\mathrm{B}\left(\mathrm{V}_{\mathrm{A}}-\mathrm{V}_{\mathrm{B}}\right)\) is:
Reactance of a capacitor of capacitance \(\mathrm{C} \mu \mathrm{F}\) for ac frequency \(\frac{400}{\pi} \mathrm{Hz}\) is \(25 \Omega\). The value \(\mathrm{C}\) is:

Two resistors of \(10 \Omega\) and \(20 \Omega\) and an ideal inductor of \(10 \mathrm{H}\) are connected to a \(2 \mathrm{~V}\) battery as shown in Fig. Key \(\mathrm{K}\) is inserted at time \(\mathrm{t}=0\). The initial \((\mathrm{t}=0)\) and final \((t \rightarrow \infty)\) currents through the battery are:
A copper disc of radius \(5 \mathrm{~cm}\) is rotating in magnetic field \(\mathrm{B}=0.2\) Gauss with 20 rev./sec. What will be a potential difference across the periphery and center of the disk:

A conducting circular loop is placed in a uniform magnetic field, \(\mathrm{B}=0.025 \mathrm{~T}\) with its plane perpendicular to the loop. The radius of the loop is made to shrink at a constant rate of \(1 \mathrm{~mm} \mathrm{~s}{ }^{-1}\). The induced emf when the radius is \(2 \mathrm{~cm}\), is

A conducting circular loop is placed in a uniform magnetic field of \(0.04 \mathrm{~T}\) with its plane perpendicular to the magnetic field. The radius of the loop starts shrinking at \(2 \mathrm{~mm} / \mathrm{s}\). The induced emf in the loop when the radius is \(2 \mathrm{~cm}\) is:

A conducting square loop is placed in a magnetic field \(B\) with its plane perpendicular to the field. The sides of the loop start shrinking at a constant rate \(\alpha /\) The induced emf in the loop at an instant when its side is ' a' is:

A closed planar wire loop of area A and arbitrary shape is placed in a uniform magnetic field of magnitude \(\mathrm{B}\), with its plane perpendicular to the magnetic field. The resistance of the wire loop is \(\mathrm{R}\). The loop is now turned upside down by \(180^{\circ}\) so that its plane again becomes perpendicular to the magnetic field. The total charge that must have flowed through the wire ring in the process is:
A coil of inductance \(300 \mathrm{mH}\) and resistance \(2 \Omega\) is connected to a source of voltage \(2 \mathrm{~V}\). The current reaches half of its steady state value in:
If an \(8 \Omega\) resistance and \(6 \Omega\) reactance are present in an ac series circuit then the impedance of the circuit will be:

In an oscillating \(\mathrm{L}-\mathrm{C}\) circuit, the maximum charge on the capacitor is \(\mathrm{Q}\). The charge on the capacitor, when the energy is stored equally between the electric and magnetic field is:
An AC source of variable frequency f is connected to an LCR series circuit. Which of the following graphs represents the variation of currentin the circuit with frequency?

A 100 volt A.C. source of frequency 500 hertz is connected to a L-C-R circuit with L \(=8.1\) millihenry, \(\mathrm{C}=12.5\) microfarad and \(\mathrm{R}=10 \mathrm{ohm}\), all connected in series. The potential difference across the resistance will be:
If resistance of \(100 \Omega\) and the inductance of \(0.5\) henry and capacitance of \(10 \times 10^{6}\) farad are connected in series through \(50 \mathrm{~Hz}\) A.C supp;y, then impedence is:
Power dissipated in an LCR series circuit connected to an a.c. source of emf \(\epsilon\) is:

When an AC source of emf E = E0 sin (100t) is connected across a circuit, the phase difference between the emf E and the current I in the circuit is observed to be/4 as shown in the figure below. If the circuit consists possibly only of R-C or R-L or L-C in series, then what will be the values of the two elements of the circuit?
In an \(\mathrm{AC}\) circuit, the current lags behind the voltage by \(\pi / 3\). The components of the circuit are:

A transformer with primary to secondary turns ratio of \(1: 2\), is connected to an alternator of voltage \(200 \mathrm{~V}\). A current of \(4 \mathrm{~A}\) is flowing through the primary coil. Assuming that the transformer has no losses, the secondary voltage and current are respectively:

When a \(60 \mathrm{mH}\) inductor and resistor are connected in series with an \(\mathrm{AC}\) voltage source, the voltage leads the current by \(60^{\circ}\). If the inductor is replaced by a \(0.5 \mathrm{mF}\) capacitor, the voltage lags behind the current by \(30^{\circ}\). What is the frequency of the \(\mathrm{AC}\) supply?
Eddy current can be minimised by:

A step-down transformer transforms a supply line voltage of 2200 V into 220 V. The primary coil has 5000 turns. If the efficiency and power transmitted by the transformer are 90% and 8 kW, respectively, then the power supplied is :

q_option: Work done by the battery is half of the energy dissipated in the resistor
1.q_string: In an \(\mathrm{LCR}\) circuit as shown in figure, both switches are open initially. Now switch \(\mathrm{S}_{1}\) is closed, \(\mathrm{S}_{2}\) kept open. ( \(\mathrm{q}\) is charge on the capacitor and \(4 \tau=\mathrm{RC}\) is capacity time constant). Which of the following statement is correct?

A metallic disc of diameter \(15 \mathrm{~cm}\) rotates horizentally at \(\frac{100}{3} \mathrm{rev}, / \mathrm{min}\). If the value of vertical component of magnetic filed is \(0.01 \mathrm{wb} / \mathrm{m}^{2}\). Calculate the induced emf between centre and its ends.

A \(1.5 \mu \mathrm{F}\) capacitor is charged of \(60 \mathrm{~V}\). The charging battery is then disconnected and a \(15 \mathrm{mH}\) coil is connected in series with the capacitor so that LC oscillations occurs. Assuming that the circuit contains no resistance. The maximum current in this coil shall be close to.
